page.title: 16RISELEY SCOUTS
page.content: Riseley Scout group are part of the Ouse Valley District,Bedfordshire. The group was first formed in 1917 and until 1937 and a present group we started in 1967. The group is now made up as following:18 Beavers aged 6 to 8 years with 3 leaders,14 cub scouts aged 8 to 10 years with 3 leaders and 1 instructor,18 scouts aged 10 to 15 years with 3 leaders and a commitee of parents and friends who support the leaders and boys. The boys come from most villages within a 5 mile radius of Riseley. The Beavers and cubs meet at the Margaret Beaufort School and the scouts at their new hut by the drive to Melchbourne House. The Pump House in Gold Street is now used to store the group's camping equipment.
